required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Management of Major Bleeding Events in Atrial Fibrillation Patients Using Pradaxa
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Cohort Study With Chart Review to Assess the Management of Major Bleeding Events in NVAF Patients Treated With Dabigatran Etexilate

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted to collect data on the management of major bleeding events occurring in patients with atrial fibrillation taking dabigatran etexilate.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with index event safety outcomes (ongoing/resolved/deceased)
primary_outcome.time_frame: at time of hospital discharge/release with an average hospital stay of approximately 9 days

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients receiving different types of interventions to stop the index events
primary_outcome.time_frame: until hospital discharge/release with an avergae hospital stay of approximately 9 days

primary_outcome.measure: Frequencies of bleeding types and anatomic locations of the index event
primary_outcome.time_frame: at time presentation or hospitalization, day 1

study_pop.textblock: AF patients with bleeding event using Dabigatran etexilate
